page.title: 02Tourism Stirling
page.content: Many people come to visit Stirling because of the shopping centre, sports and leisure facilites and the tourist attractions such as the castle, the Guildhall, the Holy Rude Church and many other historical buildings which have a very exciting past and are very interesting to look at. People come to live in Stirling because it is smaller and friendlier than larger towns and cities. We interviewed 100 children in our school and we found that 53 of them were born in Stirling, but 68 of the parents are newcomers to Stirling. Only 45% of the fathers work in Stirling but 55% work in Glasgow or Edinburgh or outside Stirling. They chose to live here because of the easy communications with other towns and cities by motorway, train and bus services.
